info.title: Kings Arms, Wilmslow
info.address: Fulshaw Gate, Alderley Rd, Wilmslow SK9 1PZ, United Kingdom

James and his mum where very welcoming.
Very nice people.
Rooms where clean and comfortable.

Great Robinson's pub which also has a Thi restaurant and bed and breakfast attached.

Good selection of Robinson's ales on tap.

James and his staff arecwsrm and welcoming.

A good venue for live music lovers.

data.text: Ein typisch englisches Pup wo auch einmal die Woche live Music, Drinks,Beer and food Service.

data.text: Haven't been in a while. But the live music and atmosphere they have on a Saturday takes some beating. So they defo deserve this good review.

data.text:
Called in for a couple of beers.

Very friendly and good beer. Great staff.

Can definitely recommend 👌
data.name: Graham Spence

data.text: Lovely friendly " proper " pub where dogs are welcome. Will hopefully come back
data.name: Michele Thompson

data.text: Went to a family wake and the food was amazing especially the home made pie
data.name: Elaine James

data.text: Lovely dog friendly pub with Thai food restaurant attached food delicious 😋
data.name: Beryl Williamson

data.text: Fantastic stay many thanks to all the team
data.name: william atkinsom

data.text:
Back to the way pubs used to be, there was a real sense of welcome on arrival, and also a lot of looks from the locals as I was a new face. I instantly got talking to the guy on the stool next to me followed by another local who also seemed keen to socialise.
Quite a few in the big room watching football, a few people to the sides reading books and the papers.
The fact its attached to a restaurant lends itself to staying for that extra drink, and taking a meal home to appease the wife!
Really nice bar and environment, it's back to how pubs used to be, makes a really refreshing change.
data.name: mafu Inglis

data.text: Very dog friendly, and good food.
data.name: Ian Fletcher

data.text:
Small, basic room.  However,  spotlessly clean.  Very friendly and helpful staff.  Delicious full English breakfast. Five minute walk into quaint high street shops.  Perfect for overnight stay before flying out of Manchester.  Free overnight parking.
Would stay here again in a heartbeat.
data.name: Lindsay Torralba

data.text:
Great traditional pub with a good selection of beers. Very warm welcome from the landlord and staff.
The live music from the locals on the Thursday evening was a very welcome bonus.
The rooms are clean and warm and the attached Thai restaurant is definitely worth a visit.
Will definitely be back soon.
data.name: zeroporker69

data.text: Great Thai meal.
data.name: Linda Hawcroft

data.text: Had a lovely time here stayed before going to the airport the landlady was lovely room basic but clean and comfortable 15 mins walk from town centre will definitely book again
data.name: sarah barker

data.text: Lovely clean overnight stay and great food from the Thai.
data.name: Lindsey Warner

data.text: I stayed in one of the rooms overnight - great experience! Kind staff, clean room, fast free wifi, and inexpensive. The thai resturaunt next door serves food straight to the pub which was delicious. Good ales on tap. Only a short walk into the town center. Would go out of my way to stay here again!
data.name: Robbie Dow

data.text:
Called in for a quick drink mid afternoon so very difficult to judge fairly when the pub was completely dead with a bell on the bar to summon staff.( This looks to be the normal during the day).
Google had seemed to indicate the pub did food all day but definitely not the case!
17.30 onwards is my suggestion to try mid week.
Pint of Dizzy Blonde on good form, outside seating comfortable with big canopies providing shade.
data.name: Nigel Larner

data.text: It's ok
data.name: Craig Keith Gagon

data.text: We stayed here, when we came up for a wedding, it was the best place I've ever stayed, spotlessly clean, lovely friendly owners, the breakfast was delicious, will definitely return and highly recommended you vist, you will receive the best of welcomes and not be disappointed...
data.name: Rachel Jones

data.text: Verry cool l like this
data.name: Gheorghita Partene

data.text: Nice with good music and company
data.name: Frederick Cooper

data.text: Great atmosphere and beer, great entertainment
data.name: David Gosling

data.text: Nice place
data.name: darren barry

data.text: Lovely pub with plenty of cask ales on tap. You can even order Thai food from the restaurant next door and get it served to your table in the pub.
data.name: Aidan Farrell

data.text: Great local pub, with best Thai food in the area on site
data.name: John Tomlinson

data.text: Friendly staff and atmosphere. Usually has live music on a Saturday night. Excellent Thai restaurant on site.
data.name: Tony Brown

data.text: Clean. Comfortable.  Lovely staff
data.name: Ruth Burnell

data.text: Great night very good band staff brilliant look forward  to next Saturday
data.name: kevan hibbert

data.text:
Had great expectations coming here. Big varied menu, friendly staff as you walk in and the place looks fantastic.

I've given this place 3 chances for food and it wasn't for me.
Maybe a quick pint next time and that's it.

First time, I thought I'd treat myself to one of their big 15oz steaks. Peppercorn sauce was watery and the steak wasn't seasoned. Chips were so so and made a mental note that they aren't worth it next time.

Second, when we arrived for our booking I was told there was no space in the restaurant even though I'd called a few days before and booked. Ordered the same steak medium rare and not wanting to make a fuss said "can it be cooked with extra pepper" To make sure it was seasoned. Came out blue rare and unseasoned, asked them to thrown it back on and for seasoning. Back out unseasoned. I gave up on the steaks.

Last time, neighbour invited us out, I thought I'll just have something little, came out no problem, nothing to rave about, but no complaints. But 2 on my table said their steaks were under done and needed salt. No one said anything.

Need to work on their steaks, especially seeing as they take up a good size of the menu and have great cuts available locally.

Better places within walking distance to go for food.
I'd say this place would be perfect for summer days for a nice cold drink or a lunch during a walk. But not a wine and dine date with your SO.
data.name: Leighton Holtam
data.responseFromOwnerText: Hello, I think you have reviewed the wrong pub.

data.text: My favourite friendly local
data.name: Anna Dakin

data.text: Just stopped by for a pint. Friendly staff and a darts board for a bit of free fun.
data.name: James Morphet

data.text:
Checked in by a member of staff who seemed like he didnt want to be there.
Room was very cold. Heating could not be turned on. Could feel the steel springs through the mattress. Dated and old. Mould around the window frames. Bathroom door was one and a half tv remotes wide. Would I go back there....Not for free! Sorry!
data.name: Eric Marshall

data.text: Nice little pub, good atmosphere and a great band.
data.name: David Fallows

data.text: Arrived around 2pm after a trip out to Congleton. Expecting a normal Robinson's pub and therefore pub grub, but was surprised to find a Thai restaurant attached instead. Had starter and a main meal and what a excellent meal it was. Would return again, when in the area again.
data.name: Jon Shailer

data.text: Staff ways pleasant, great atmosphere and good drink selection.
data.name: Laup

data.text: Belton's on draught !!
data.name: Chris Danson

data.text: The Kingo is a time honoured tradition

data.text: Visiting Manchester and family so tried local pub.  Very traditional. Fab beer. Very friendly staff

data.text:
Lovely pub and the Thai restaurant next to it had good food and great service.
There was live music outside in the evening that was very pleasant

data.text: Fun, great food and good drinks

data.text: We ate in the Tai restaurant ( a treat from our son and his partner)and had a nice meal served by friendly and likeable staff.

data.text:
Great outside seating area, good atmosphere here.
Fantastic staff and friendly landlord.

data.text: Good beer, super friendly staff. Great pub food served from the Thai next door, great vegan options.

data.text: Great experience in these CV-19 times, the Landlord is taking great care of his customers. Thank you.  Great Beer,  friendly welcoming place, with good out door spaces, thoroughly recommend, you can even enjoy lovely Thai food eat in or take away from the adjoining restaurant.

data.text: Very good place for a short stay...good Thai restaurant and pub as well....

data.text: Live music and a good atmosphere

data.text: Really good atmosphere, great live music from The Recliners. Highly recommended!

data.text:
Great pub and Thai restaurant. Room was basic but clean and tidy with a very comfortable bed and warm room. Extremely friendly staff. Thai restaurant food was extremely good! Best Thai food I’ve had.
I will happily stay there again. 10/10.

data.text: Very welcoming pub with great live music

data.text: Great beers

data.text: Lovely typical British pub. Friendly staff. Escape the madness that is Wilmslow and Alderley Edge.

data.text: A typical village local pub in Wilmslow. Good selection of beers. No food available but there is a Thai restaurant attached to the pub which operates independently apparently. I tried it and found it to be really good.

data.text: Fab place always so welcoming and staff brilliant

data.text: It was nice but drinks expensive

data.text: Great pub, friendly and has live music Thursday's and Saturdays. Thai restaurant next door is excellent and you can eat in the bar as well

data.text: Good open mic night Thursdays. A bit pricey.

data.text: Good atmosphere, good location. good music but played too late. good value
data.name: Rutie Adar

data.text: A local pub/ bar in Manchester with options to stay as their bed and breakfast. The offer a complete English breakfast which is amazing and filling enough to get you through more than half your day. They rooms as cozy with really clean rooms and well stocked bathrooms. Do try calling out on the number provided.
data.name: Nigel Pinto

data.text: Old fashioned. Needs a revamp.
data.name: David Swan

data.text: Ate fabulous food in the adjoining Panthong Thai and enjoyed great live music in the friendly pub afterwards.
data.name: Allan Richardson

data.text: Nice pub With nice  people.
data.name: Paul Thompson

data.text: Mint meeting place ,, love the friendly vibe in there ,, been going for years
data.name: carlton harris

data.text: Do not book room 5 at a weekend if you want any sleep. The live music in the bar actually made the floor and beds vibrate it was that loud, and when we complained we were told they had a license until 1am so to be thankful the music would stop @ 11:30. Suffice to say it was nearly midnight when it finally stopped. Other than that, the single glazed window didn't shut properly, the heating was off and the shower has no door so the floor got very wet. We won't be staying there again!!!
data.name: Robin Bills

data.text: Tip top
data.name: Tony Wood

data.text: Superb pub food excellent nice and friendly staying again

data.text: Great hats!

data.text: Chalk board left on middle of pavement obstructing pedestrians and especially people with disabilities. Dust and flies behind the chairs and on window sills. Don't think I'd go there. Hopefully this review will stop Google pestering me to review the place when all I do is walk past.

data.text: Friendly drinking pub. Very comfortable, mixed clients, can have a good catch up with friends or just sit and read the paper. Good place to watch the footy without being too rowdy. Well kept Robinson's beers. Food available in Thai for both eat in or take away. Nice to have a pub that is not about food.

I love a wine and a chat. I love a traditional pub.
But I was disappointed by the lower end choice available.
Guys! Get in a quality range and I'll visit more often!
